title: Shayara Bano v. Union of India (Triple Talaq Verdict)
summary: A case challenging the constitutionality of instant triple talaq (talaq-e-biddat) practiced in the Muslim community.
judgment: The Supreme Court declared instant triple talaq unconstitutional by a 3:2 majority.

title: Justice K.S. Puttaswamy (Retd.) v. Union of India
summary: A case examining whether the right to privacy is a fundamental right under the Indian Constitution.
judgment: The Supreme Court unanimously held that the right to privacy is a fundamental right under Article 21.

title: Indian Young Lawyers Association v. State of Kerala
summary: Concerned with the ban on entry of women aged 10-50 into the Sabarimala Temple.
judgment: The SC ruled that the practice violated women's rights and allowed their entry.

title: Murder and Rape under Sections 302 & 376
summary: A 23-year-old woman was brutally raped and murdered in a moving bus in Delhi later known as the Nirbhaya case
judgment: All four adult accused were sentenced to death by hanging.
bench: Justice Dipak Misra, Justice R. Banumathi

title: Triple Homicide and Psychotic Behavior
summary: A man suffering from paranoid schizophrenia murdered his wife and two children claiming voices told him to do so
judgment: Accused found not guilty by reason of insanity and sent for psychiatric care.

title: Acid Attack and Attempt to Murder
summary: A woman threw acid on her partners face after a dispute causing permanent disfigurement and partial blindness
judgment: Accused sentenced to 10 years rigorous imprisonment and â‚¹5 lakh compensation.

title: Navtej Singh Johar v. Union of India
summary: Challenged the constitutionality of Section 377 IPC that criminalized same-sex relations.
judgment: SC decriminalized consensual gay sex declaring Section 377 unconstitutional in part.

title: K.S. Puttaswamy v. Union of India (Aadhaar Case)
summary: Concerned the validity of Aadhaar Act and its use for welfare schemes and authentication.
judgment: Aadhaar was upheld with some restrictions; private companies were barred from requiring it.

title: M. Siddiq (D) Thr. Lrs. v. Mahant Suresh Das
summary: Longstanding Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute in Ayodhya.
judgment: SC awarded disputed land to the Ram Janmabhoomi trust and ordered alternate land for mosque.

title: Honour Killing under Section 302
summary: A couple was murdered by the girls family in a classic case of honour killing in Haryana
judgment: All accused were sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: Serial Murders and Cannibalism
summary: A mentally unstable man confessed to killing six people and consuming parts of their remains
judgment: Accused found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment without parole.

title: Rape of Minor under POCSO Act
summary: A school teacher raped a 14-year-old student repeatedly over months inside school premises
judgment: Accused sentenced to 20 years imprisonment under POCSO Act.

title: Rajiv Gandhi Assassination Case
summary: In 1991 former PM Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated by an LTTE suicide bomber during a campaign rally
judgment: 7 accused convicted; death penalty for 4; later commuted for some.

title: 1984 Anti-Sikh Riots PIL
summary: A PIL filed against delay in justice for 1984 riots that followed Indira Gandhi assassination
judgment: SC ordered formation of SIT for reinvestigation in multiple cases.

title: Bombay Underworld Shootout Case
summary: Case involving encounter killings of underworld gang members by Mumbai Police in 1997
judgment: SC upheld that encounters must be legally justified; ordered independent inquiry.

title: Mohd. Ahmed Khan vs Shah Bano Begum
summary: In 1985 a 62-year-old Muslim woman sought maintenance after divorce triggering national debate on secular laws
judgment: SC ruled in favor of Shah Bano under CrPC Sec 125; later overturned by Parliament.

title: Union Carbide Corporation vs Union of India
summary: After the 1984 gas leak disaster Union Carbide reached a settlement with GoI; victims challenged it
judgment: SC upheld $470 million settlement but ordered medical care and monitoring.

title: Hawala Scandal PIL (Jain Diaries)
summary: Exposed illegal payoffs to politicians via hawala brokers in 1990s using secret diaries
judgment: SC ordered CBI probe; laid down guidelines for transparent investigation.
bench: Justice S.P. Bharucha, Justice S.C. Sen
